programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Tylor Megill throws for the Mets in the finale of a four-game series with the Giants. Megill took his first loss of 2023 in his last outing as Miami touched him for three runs in five innings, but the California native is still 3-1 with a 3.00 ERA.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Warriors try to tie up their first-round series with the Kings in Game 4. Golden State cut the deficit to 2-1 with a 114-97 victory. The Dubs' Stephen Curry lit Sacramento up in Christmas tree-fashion with 12-of-25 shooting, and 36 points.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: This Just In
programme.desc: The latest news, opinion and analysis on the day's trending and under-the-radar afternoon headlines; a look ahead at the evening's potential news-making moments.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Keyshawn Johnson, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The rejuvenated Devils visit the Rangers for Game 4 of a first-round series. New Jersey trails 2-1 after a 2-1 victory in Game 3 on Dougie Hamilton's goal at 11:36 of overtime. The Devils' Akira Schmid made 35 saves in his first playoff appearance.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Jets try to even their first-round series versus the Golden Knights in Game 4. Winnipeg forced overtime after erasing a 4-1 third-period deficit, but Vegas ultimately took Game 3 with Michael Amadio's first career playoff goal in double overtime.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Hurricanes return home with a 3-1 lead on the Islanders for Game 5 of their first-round series. Carolina is one win away from advancing after a 5-2 victory in Game 4 behind a pair of goals by Seth Jarvis and three points from Sebastian Aho.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Oilers seek an advantage over the Kings in Game 5 of their Western Conference quarterfinal. Leon Draisaitl scored twice as Edmonton erased a three-goal deficit in Game 4, and teammate Zach Hyman netted the overtime winner to tie the series 2-2.

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Bruins return home with a chance to oust the Panthers in Game 5 of their first-round set. Boston rolled to a 6-2 victory in Game 4 to take a 3-1 series lead. Bruins forwards Jake DeBrusk and Taylor Hall scored two goals apiece in that affair.

programme.title: XFL Football
programme.desc: From Lumen Field in Seattle.

programme.title: Cornhole
programme.desc: Action from the lawn game in which players try to toss a bean bag into a hole at the end of a raised platform.

programme.title: Player 54: Chasing the XFL Dream
programme.desc: Coach Wade Phillips and the Houston Roughnecks bring back a familiar face to offset recent injuries. Tensions rise for coach Terrell Buckley and the winless Orlando Guardians, who host the Seattle Sea Dragons, a team looking to extend its win streak.

programme.title: Player 54: Chasing the XFL Dream
programme.desc: Terrell Buckley and the Orlando Guardians face their toughest test yet when they meet the ruthless D.C. Defenders defense. The Defenders then turn their attention in Week 8 to an intradivision matchup against the surging Seattle Sea Dragons.

programme.title: E60
programme.desc: Psychedelics may be the future of mental health treatment in sports. E60 follows a group of former athletes with a range of mental and physical conditions as they take part in a medical retreat involving psilocybin, aka Magic Mushrooms.

programme.title: On the Clock
programme.desc: Follow NFL QB prospect Hendon Hooker through his final college football season and into the offseason as he prepares for the NFL combine, pro day and the NFL draft. NFL legends Archie, Peyton and Eli Manning evaluate and serve as mentors.

programme.title: On the Clock
programme.desc: Follow NFL QB prospect Will Levis through his final college football season and into the offseason as he prepares for the NFL combine, pro day and the NFL draft. NFL legends Archie, Peyton and Eli Manning evaluate and serve as mentors.

programme.title: Hey Rookie, Welcome to the NFL
programme.desc: NFL rookies get their first taste of professional football at training camp.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Knicks look to take a commanding 3-1 lead in Game 4 of their first-round series against the Cavaliers. New York held Cleveland to the lowest point total in the NBA this season in Game 3, as the Cavs shot just 38.8% from the field in a 99-79 loss.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Tylor Megill throws for the Mets in the finale of a four-game series with the Giants. Megill took his first loss of 2023 in his last outing as Miami touched him for three runs in five innings, but the California native is still 3-1 with a 3.00 ERA.

programme.title: Keyshawn, JWill and Max
programme.desc: ‎Every morning, Keyshawn Johnson joins Jay Williams and Max Kellerman as they set the sports table for the day. From the games that electrified us the night before to the stories that will catch fire during the day, the guys will update and inform.

programme.title: Daily Wager
programme.desc: Doug Kezirian joins sports betting experts as well as ESPN analysts and reporters from various sports for discussion centered on analytics and point spreads as well as how the day's sports news affects betting.

programme.title: The Point
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship hockey show featuring highlights, news, analysis, speed, skill and access to the biggest stars, stories and personalities of the game. Hosted by John Buccigross.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special
programme.desc: Presenting the latest news from the world of sports.

programme.title: On the Clock
programme.desc: Follow NFL QB prospect Will Levis through his final college football season and into the offseason as he prepares for the NFL combine, pro day and the NFL draft. NFL legends Archie, Peyton and Eli Manning evaluate and serve as mentors.

programme.title: On the Clock
programme.desc: Follow NFL QB prospect Anthony Richardson through his final college football season and into the offseason as he prepares for the NFL combine, pro day and the NFL draft. NFL legends Archie, Peyton and Eli Manning evaluate and serve as mentors.

programme.title: NFL Matchup: Draft Special
programme.desc: Sal Paolantonio, Darius Butler and Greg Cosell analyze prospects with how they fit in today's NFL game.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: This Just In
programme.desc: The latest news, opinion and analysis on the day's trending and under-the-radar afternoon headlines; a look ahead at the evening's potential news-making moments.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: Daily Wager
programme.desc: Doug Kezirian joins sports betting experts as well as ESPN analysts and reporters from various sports for discussion centered on analytics and point spreads as well as how the day's sports news affects betting.

programme.title: The Point
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship hockey show featuring highlights, news, analysis, speed, skill and access to the biggest stars, stories and personalities of the game. Hosted by John Buccigross.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special
programme.desc: Presenting the latest news from the world of sports.

programme.title: Hey Rookie, Welcome to the NFL
programme.desc: NFL rookies get their first taste of professional football at training camp.

programme.title: On the Clock
programme.desc: Follow NFL QB prospect Hendon Hooker through his final college football season and into the offseason as he prepares for the NFL combine, pro day and the NFL draft. NFL legends Archie, Peyton and Eli Manning evaluate and serve as mentors.

programme.title: On the Clock
programme.desc: Follow NFL QB prospect Will Levis through his final college football season and into the offseason as he prepares for the NFL combine, pro day and the NFL draft. NFL legends Archie, Peyton and Eli Manning evaluate and serve as mentors.

programme.title: On the Clock
programme.desc: Follow NFL QB prospect Anthony Richardson through his final college football season and into the offseason as he prepares for the NFL combine, pro day and the NFL draft. NFL legends Archie, Peyton and Eli Manning evaluate and serve as mentors.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: DC & RC
programme.desc: Former UFC two-division champion Daniel Cormier and former Super Bowl champion Ryan Clark talk about their shared love of MMA and the rest of the sports world.

programme.title: Hey Rookie, Welcome to the NFL
programme.desc: NFL rookies get their first taste of professional football at training camp.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Keyshawn Johnson, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Hurricanes return home with a 3-1 lead on the Islanders for Game 5 of their first-round series. Carolina is one win away from advancing after a 5-2 victory in Game 4 behind a pair of goals by Seth Jarvis and three points from Sebastian Aho.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Keyshawn, JWill and Max
programme.desc: ‎Every morning, Keyshawn Johnson joins Jay Williams and Max Kellerman as they set the sports table for the day. From the games that electrified us the night before to the stories that will catch fire during the day, the guys will update and inform.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: Player 54: Chasing the XFL Dream
programme.desc: All-access with XFL players and coaches, such as AJ McCarron & Hines Ward. Co-owned by Dany Garcia & Dwayne Johnson, the league is where dreams meet opportunity.

programme.title: USFL Football
programme.desc: From Tom Benson Hall of Fame Stadium in Canton, Ohio.

programme.title: USFL Football
programme.desc: The defending USFL champion Stallions host the Showboats in Week 2. Birmingham will be without injured players Scooby Wright and Marlon Williams. From Protective Stadium in Birmingham, Ala.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: EJ Tackett meets Anthony Simonsen in the WSOB XIV World Championship Finals. Tackett, a 20-time PBA Tour winner, seeks his fifth victory and second major title this season. From Milwaukee.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Hub
programme.desc: Highlights, news, opinion, and a heavy dose of unexpected fun from the always-rocking world of NASCAR.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: The NASCAR Cup Series schedule rolls on with the Geico 500. Kyle Larson has won two of his past three starts after standing atop the NOCO 400 on April 16. Larson finished fourth in this race in 2022, while Ross Chastain claimed the checkered flag.

programme.title: The Carton Show
programme.desc: Craig Carton brings his unique style to the day's biggest sports stories. Joined by guests and analysts, Carton will give the first perspective of the day on all the major topics.

programme.title: Skip and Shannon: Undisputed
programme.desc: Skip and Shannon give their unfiltered, passionate opinions on the biggest sports topics of the day.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Colin Cowherd and co-host Jason McIntyre break down the biggest stories and interview the biggest guests in sports.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Nick Wright, Chris Broussard, and Kevin Wildes bring viewers spirited dialogue and thought-provoking discussion on the day's biggest sports stories.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: Emmanuel Acho, Joy Taylor, and LeSean McCoy bring a fun, passionate, smart, and energetic discussion to the biggest sports topics of the day.

programme.desc: Highlights, news, opinion, and a heavy dose of unexpected fun from the always-rocking world of NASCAR.

programme.title: NASCAR Presents
programme.desc: NASCAR Race Hub presents inspiring stories about the history and legends of NASCAR. Season 8 of the Beyond the Wheel Short Films series includes Vintage to Vogue, Evolution - Stock Car to Racecar and Beating the Odds - The Ernie Irvan Story.

programme.title: MLB on FS1 Pregame
programme.desc: Previews of the day's games, highlights, updates and analysis.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: The Athletics and Angels renew acquaintances in the lid-lifter of a four-game series. Los Angeles took two of three from Oakland to start the season despite outscoring the A's 20-3 in the games. Halos catcher Logan O'Hoppe drove in six of those runs.

programme.title: Searching for Shohei: An Interview Special
programme.desc: Ben Verlander sits down with international baseball phenom and Los Angeles Angels pitcher/designated hitter, Shohei Ohtani, for an exclusive all-access interview and in-depth conversation about Ohtani's unique path to superstardom.

programme.desc: The NASCAR Xfinity Series feels the need for speed during the Ag-Pro 300 at Talladega.

programme.title: Inside the NBA
programme.desc: This Emmy Award-winning studio show, which airs following each NBA telecast on TNT, is hosted by Ernie Johnson, with analysis from Hall of Famer Charles Barkley and NBA champions Kenny Smith and Shaquille O'Neal. It's a mix of highlights, interviews and hijinks, notably the verbal sparring sessions between the outspoken Barkley and his straight man, Smith. The show also welcomes various guest analysts throughout the season.

programme.title: What If?
programme.desc: Rewriting NBA history, such as if Robert Horry missed his game winner against the Kings, if Gregg Popovich was fired from the Spurs before their first title, if the Magic didn't trade Chris Webber, and many more.

programme.title: What If?
programme.desc: Rewriting NBA history, such as if Nets had drafted Kobe Bryant, if the Bulls had traded the pick that became Michael Jordan, if the Timberwolves didn't pass on Steph Curry, if the Sonics didn't trade Scottie Pippen and many more.

programme.desc: The Nuggets try again to knock off the Timberwolves in Game 5 of their Western quarterfinal. Anthony Edwards poured in 34 points as Minnesota staved off elimination with an overtime win against Denver in Game 4. Nikola Jokic (DEN) scored 43 points.

programme.desc: Review of the game; highlights; interviews with players and coaches.

programme.title: Inside the NBA
programme.desc: This Emmy Award-winning studio show, which airs following each NBA telecast on TNT, is hosted by Ernie Johnson, with analysis from Hall of Famer Charles Barkley and NBA champions Kenny Smith and Shaquille O'Neal. It's a mix of highlights, interviews and hijinks, notably the verbal sparring sessions between the outspoken Barkley and his straight man, Smith. The show also welcomes various guest analysts throughout the season.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The scene shifts back to Ohio for Game 5 of an Eastern quarterfinal between New York and Cleveland. The Knicks won both games in New York, holding Cleveland to 79 points April 21 and putting the Cavaliers on the brink with a 102-93 decision April 23.
